intro: Uropetalon viride, commonly known as green star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white or greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, fragrant blooms during the spring season. Uropetalon viride is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
